 1917:     io:format("~p~n", [erlang:match_spec_test([1], MS, trace)]),
 1918:     _ = erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, MS, []),
 1919:     %% Now test a match spec using excessive nesting. This
 1920:     %% used to seg-fault the emulator due to recursion
 1921:     %% beyond the end of the C-stack.
 1922:     %%
 1923:     %% We expect to get a system_limit error, but don't
 1924:     %% fail if it compiles (someone must have rewritten
 1925:     %% compilation of match specs to use an explicit
 1926:     %% stack instead of using recursion).
 1927:     ENMS = [{['$1'], [MkMSCond(MkMSCond, 1000000)], []}],
 1928:     io:format("~p~n", [erlang:match_spec_test([1], ENMS, trace)]),
 1929:     try
 1930:         _ = erlang_trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, ENMS, []),
 1931:         {comment, "compiled"}
 1932:     catch
 1933:         error:system_limit ->
 1934:             {comment, "got system_limit"}
 1935:     end.
 1936: 
 1937: drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon) ->
 1938:     drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon, false, 0, 0).
 1939: 
 1940: drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon, TDRef, N, D) ->
 1941:     case receive Msg -> Msg end of
 1942:         {trace_delivered, Proc, TDRef} ->
 1943:             io:format("~p trace messages on 'DOWN'~n", [D]),
 1944:             io:format("Got a total of ~p trace messages~n", [N]),
 1945:             N;
 1946:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, Proc, _} ->
 1947:             Ref = erlang:trace_delivered(Proc),
 1948:             drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon, Ref, N, N);
 1949:         Trace when is_tuple(Trace),
 1950:                    element(1, Trace) == trace,
 1951:                    element(2, Trace) == Proc ->
 1952:             drop_trace_until_down(Proc, Mon, TDRef, N+1, D)
 1953:     end.
 1954: 
 1955: tok_trace_loop(_, N, N) ->
 1956:     ok;
 1957: tok_trace_loop(Parent, N, M) ->
 1958:     Name = 'A really stupid name which I will unregister at once',
 1959:     link(Parent),
 1960:     register(Name, self()),
 1961:     unregister(Name),
 1962:     unlink(Parent),
 1963:     tok_trace_loop(Parent, N+1, M).
 1964: 
 1965: %% Waits for and returns the first message in the message queue.
 1966: 
 1967: receive_first() ->
 1968:     receive
 1969:         Any -> Any
 1970:     after 1000 ->
 1971:             timeout
 1972:     end.
 1973: 
 1974: %% Waits for and returns the first message in the message queue.
 1975: 
 1976: receive_first_trace() ->
 1977:     receive
 1978: 	Any when element(1,Any) =:= trace; element(1,Any) =:= trace_ts -> Any
 1979:     after 1000 ->
 1980:             timeout
 1981:     end.
 1982: 
 1983: %% Ensures that there is no message in the message queue.
 1984: 
 1985: receive_nothing() ->
 1986:     receive
 1987:         Any ->
 1988:             ct:fail({unexpected_message, Any})
 1989:     after 100 ->
 1990: 	    ok
 1991:     end.
 1992: 
 1993: 
 1994: %%% Models for various kinds of processes.
 1995: 
 1996: process(Dest) ->
 1997:     receive
 1998:         {send_please, To, What} ->
 1999:             To ! What,
 2000:             process(Dest);
 2001:         {spawn_link_please, ReplyTo, {M, F, A}} ->
 2002:             Pid = spawn_link(M, F, A),
 2003:             ReplyTo ! {spawned, self(), Pid},
 2004:             process(Dest);
 2005:         {spawn_link_please, ReplyTo, Node, {M, F, A}} ->
 2006:             Pid = spawn_link(Node, M, F, A),
 2007:             ReplyTo ! {spawned, self(), Pid},
 2008:             process(Dest);
 2009:         {link_please, Pid} ->
 2010:             link(Pid),
 2011:             process(Dest);
 2012:         {unlink_please, Pid} ->
 2013:             unlink(Pid),
 2014:             process(Dest);
 2015:         {register_please, Name, Pid} ->
 2016:             register(Name, Pid),
 2017:             process(Dest);
 2018:         {unregister_please, Name} ->
 2019:             unregister(Name),
 2020:             process(Dest);
 2021:         {exit_please, Reason} ->
 2022:             exit(Reason);
 2023:         {exit_signal_please, Reason} ->
 2024:             exit(self(), Reason),
 2025:             process(Dest);
 2026:         {trap_exit_please, State} ->
 2027:             process_flag(trap_exit, State),
 2028:             process(Dest);
 2029:         Other ->
 2030:             Dest ! {self(), Other},
 2031:             process(Dest)
 2032:     after 3000 ->
 2033:               exit(timeout)
 2034:     end.
 2035: 
 2036: 
 2037: %% A smart process template.
 2038: 
 2039: process() ->
 2040:     receive
 2041:         {spawn_please, ReplyTo, Fun} ->
 2042:             Pid = fun_spawn(Fun),
 2043:             ReplyTo ! {spawned, Pid},
 2044:             process();
 2045:         {send_please, To, What} ->
 2046:             To ! What,
 2047:             process();
 2048:         timeout_please ->
 2049:             receive after 1 -> process() end;
 2050:         _Other ->
 2051:             process()
 2052:     end.
 2053: 
 2054: 
 2055: %% Sends messages when ordered to.
 2056: 
 2057: sender() ->
 2058:     receive
 2059:         {send_please, To, What} ->
 2060:             To ! What,
 2061:             sender()
 2062:     end.
 2063: 
 2064: 
 2065: %% Just consumes messages from its message queue.
 2066: 
 2067: receiver() ->
 2068:     receiver(infinity).
 2069: 
 2070: receiver(Timeout) ->
 2071:     receiver(receive
 2072: 		 {set_timeout, NewTimeout} -> NewTimeout;
 2073: 		 _Any -> Timeout
 2074: 	     after Timeout -> infinity  %% reset
 2075: 	     end).
 2076: 
 2077: %% Works as long as it receives CPU time.  Will always be RUNNABLE.
 2078: 
 2079: worker() ->
 2080:     worker(0).
 2081: 
 2082: worker(Number) ->
 2083:     worker(Number+1).
 2084: 
 2085: fun_spawn(Fun) ->
 2086:     spawn_link(erlang, apply, [Fun, []]).
 2087: 
 2088: fun_spawn(Fun, Args) ->
 2089:     spawn_link(erlang, apply, [Fun, Args]).
 2090: 
 2091: 
 2092: wait_for_empty_runq(DeadLine) ->
 2093:     case statistics(run_queue) of
 2094:         0 -> true;
 2095:         RQLen ->
 2096:             erlang:display("Waiting for empty run queue"),
 2097:             MSDL = DeadLine*1000,
 2098:             wait_for_empty_runq(MSDL, MSDL, RQLen)
 2099:     end.
 2100: 
 2101: wait_for_empty_runq(DeadLine, Left, RQLen) when Left =< 0 ->
 2102:     issue_non_empty_runq_warning(DeadLine, RQLen),
 2103:     false;
 2104: wait_for_empty_runq(DeadLine, Left, _RQLen) ->
 2105:     Wait = 10,
 2106:     UntilDeadLine = Left - Wait,
 2107:     receive after Wait -> ok end,
 2108:     case statistics(run_queue) of
 2109:         0 ->
 2110:             erlang:display("Waited for "
 2111:                            ++ integer_to_list(DeadLine
 2112:                                               - UntilDeadLine)
 2113:                            ++ " ms for empty run queue."),
 2114:             true;
 2115:         NewRQLen ->
 2116:             wait_for_empty_runq(DeadLine,
 2117:                                 UntilDeadLine,
 2118:                                 NewRQLen)
 2119:     end.
 2120: 
 2121: issue_non_empty_runq_warning(DeadLine, RQLen) ->
 2122:     PIs = lists:foldl(
 2123:             fun (P, Acc) ->
 2124:                     case process_info(P,
 2125:                                       [status,
 2126:                                        initial_call,
 2127:                                        current_function,
 2128:                                        registered_name,
 2129:                                        reductions,
 2130:                                        message_queue_len]) of
 2131:                         [{status, Runnable} | _] = PI when Runnable /= waiting,
 2132:                                                            Runnable /= suspended ->
 2133:                             [[{pid, P} | PI] | Acc];
 2134:                         _ ->
 2135:                             Acc
 2136:                     end
 2137:             end,
 2138:             [],
 2139:             processes()),
 2140:     io:format("WARNING: Unexpected runnable processes in system (waited ~p sec).~n"
 2141:               "         Run queue length: ~p~n"
 2142:               "         Self: ~p~n"
 2143:               "         Processes info: ~p~n",
 2144:               [DeadLine div 1000, RQLen, self(), PIs]),
 2145:     receive after 1000 -> ok end.
 2146: 
 2147: load_driver(Dir, Driver) ->
 2148:     case erl_ddll:load_driver(Dir, Driver) of
 2149:         ok -> ok;
 2150:         {error, Error} = Res ->
 2151:             io:format("~s\n", [erl_ddll:format_error(Error)]),
 2152:             Res
 2153:     end.
